text: Cloudy dark yellow to orange color with minimal sized white head. Brett yeast, sour, lots of tropical fruit, citrus, pretty hoppy. Taste is sour and sweet with nicely done bitter finish. Medium to full body, small lovely burning bubbles. Alcohol hidden well.

Piękny, ale moze niezbyt intensywny zapach cytrynki, brzoskwini, sianka, lekkiej stajni, gdzieś tam na końcu surowe ciasto,już się czuje, że będzie rześko. Faktycznie tak jest, ale bez fajerwerków, wszystko stonowane i delikatne, nawet za bardzo, sól na granicy wyczuwalności, finisz goryczkowy i lekko piecze w przełyku. Dobre, ale bez fajerwerków.

Bottle from Beergium, cellared for about a year. Slightly hazy yellow with big head on top. Aroma has lots of zesty lemon and grapefruit, taste is similar at first. After a while yeast comes through a lot with dry wood and slight funk. Lightly salty finish.

Piwo ma złotą barwę, początkowo wlewa się klarowne, ale od mniej więcej połowy butelki, staje się bardzo mętne - drobinki widoczne w szkle.. Piana obfita, biała i trwała. 
Aromat intensywny, zdominowany brettanomyces w postaci słodkich owoców: ananas, brzoskwinie, w tle lekkie nuty stajenne.
W smaku lekkie, z zauważalną przyjemną słodyczą, a przy tym orzeźwiające. Pojawiają się cytrusy, słodkie owoce tropikalne i lekko stajenne nuty na finiszu. Goryczka niska, grejpfrutowa, po przełknięciu na zębach pozostaje pylasty osad.

Bottle. Clear appearance from the top, murky at the bottom. Orange color, white bubbles. Aroma is citrus, lemongrass, barn notes. Bit of funk. Flavor has quite a bit of funk, dry bitter finish. Some fruity notes. Alcohol is fairly hidden with a bit of warmth on the finish.

Crisp, slightly hazy golden coloured body with a dense, thick, five centimetre tall pure white head that fades fairly quickly to a single centimetre. Aroma of tart brett, crisp wheat and light malt and a bit of lemons and salt with a rich funk and definite yeastie kick - very nice. Medium-bodied; Deep rich malt flavours with a pungent kick of astringent medicine and funk, but the alcohol and dryness really comes throughout. Aftertaste is almost all pure brett, funk and grass - pungent with a good deal of alcohol, grain and herbs - very bitter and long-lasting. Overall, a much stronger and fuller flavoured beer than is typically made by the brewery. That said, it had its pungency which I didnt typically like as much, but the complexity is definitely there, but the flavours arent the best in their large doses - however, Im sure this is highly rated due just the label on the front of the bottle. I sampled this 50 cL bottle purchased from Craft & Growler in Dallas, Texas on 01-September-2015 for US$9,79 sampled at home in Washington on 23-February-2017.
Ripe citrus velvet funk with tropical IPA hops but in check, they compliment eachother, grainy light sweetness, medicinal, light biterness
Amazing nose full of citrus, pineapple, and faint lemon. Cascade and backing Citra. The combo reminds me a bit of a more-citrusy Amarillo.
Bottle shared with friends. Murky yellow with pure white head. Funky, fruity with earthy stable. Malt, fructose, slightly salty. A bretta to be sure.

Bottle from Beergium. Hazy orange color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, brett, spices, tropical fruits, grass, earthy notes and a bit of salt. Bitter finish with citrus, brett, spices, tropical fruits, a bit of salt and toast. Exquisite saison.

Draft Third of a Pint at Route CBC Festival at Craft Beer Co, Clapham, London in Oct 2015 - Hazy Yellowy Gold in colour. Large white head. Fruity; lemon and grapefruit. Sour, funky, brett, earthy and herbal. Citrusy hops. Great Saison! (2015-10-02)

500mL bottle from Camperdown cellars. 
Bright hazy straw body, holds a good sized dense white head.
Deliciously funky hoppy aroma! Unripe pineapple, mango, hard cheese, natural yoghurt, pine, freshly clipped grass, hay.
Lively creamy carbonation on the palate, dry well attenuated, touch of acidity is very refreshing.
Body reveals lovely tropical fruity sort of notes - mango, melon, papaya & paw paw, passionfruit, with funky notes of old cheese & yoghurt. Moderate bitterness, lingering dry finish.
This is really bloody good!
Bottle at WTF 4. Pours a cloudy gold with medium white head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is lemon zest, funk, salt, mineral. Medium body, strong brett, funk, oak, mineral, light tartness, good.
Bottle form LA. Love, love, love mineral notes in flavour. Bretts make a great job between hops. Fresh, drinkable and fantastic. Thanks.

Aroma: Bright citrus fruit, lemon rind along with soft pale fruit, apricot, peach, plum & slight malt sweetness. Taste: Pale fruit is strong in the flavour. White grapes, cantaloup & a nice tart finish. Overall: Excellent fruity farmhouse ale with no hint of alcohol. Prairie do it again.

Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a tall, pillowy white head that retracts quickly. Brew has a very high amount of carbonation and maintains a great fizzy presence through the entire drink. Aroma is truly beautiful. Lots and lots of funk with a lot of citrus - orange, light lemon, light lime and finishes with some light grassy notes. Flavor is light but complex. Early citrus hoppiness combos with a light grassy presence with just enough malt to help mellow it out. The funk comes in late in the tasting and magnificently melds with the other flavors present. Body is to be expected - light, fizzy, slightly puckering. Overall a fabulous, very well crafted beer.
#9 at bastardas blindtasting - 02.12.2016 - bottle from Joschi - Tasting notes: Brett, more lacto, wood?, Joghurt, peach, Almut:"Holz&Joghurt!"
Poured from the bottle a hazy yellow color with a fluffy white head. Fruity aroma, with a slight funk and yeast breadiness. Some lemon zest as well. Taste is slightly tart lemon.

Dingy medium yellow thick head. Aromas medium acidity, slight herbal hop, slight banana. Flavors slight banana, earthy hop, slight bubble gum slight juicy fruit. Light acidity medium sweet slight astringent bitter finish. No salt noticed. Ok but not to acidic or complex.

Bottle - looks great! Cloudy straw with a massive, quickly rising head like most prairie beers, slippery edges. Aroma is Belgian yeast galore, funky barnyard, lemon zest, spice, traces of bubblegum. Love the mouthfeel, dry with a lovely sharpness. Tart lemon, funk, urine, a little bubblegum again though. Fun to drink.
Hazy yellow, nice head, fruity aroma, lemon, lemon peel, earth, funky, bretty, bitter flavor, bretty, lemony, lemon zest, grapefruit zest, carbonated, medium bodied.
Bottle. This is a truly exceptional saison. Great balance of funk and citrus.

Bottle from Dutchs Cincinnati, shared at the May 2016 MDBG bottle share, 5/2/16. Hazy orange, large foamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of brett, orange zest, pale malt, lemon. The taste is lime, lemon, brett, pale malt. Medium bodied, bright, well balanced.

500ml served in a snifter glass. 
A: Pours a cloudy pale yellow color forming a huge and bubbled white head with good retention and some soapy lingering lacings formed and left in the glass. 
S: Very sweet, fruity and spicy (peppery). The traditional leather and slightly metallic notes provided by the brettanomyces. Strong flowery and citrus notes. Herby hops. Lemon, grapefruit, zest and melon. Honey and wheat. Sweet pale grains. Terrific. 
T: Sweet, grainy and zesty upfront. Strong notes of lemon, grapefruit, melon and sweet pale malts. Becomes quickly bitter and slightly sour with some salted hints. Notes of honey, leather and grass. Metallic hints. Great bittersweet balance. 
M: Medium body and carbonation. Bittersweet aftertaste. Mix of sweet pale malts and orange zest. Slightly salted finish.
O: Great drinkability. Excellent Farmhouse Ale. Masterpiece.

Slight haze in a yellow beer with big head on top. Aroma has lots of zesty lemon and grapefruit, then yeast kicks in with sour notes and some barnyard. Taste is nice and sour, barnyard and green apples. Citrus and lemon zest with salty ending. Medium body and high carbonation. Interesting mix of sour, zesty and salty. Really good.

W aromacie na pierwszym planie chmiele citra i cascade nadające cytrusowego, rześkiego zapachu, ponadto mocno czuć też kwiaty, nieco też stajni, ale ogólnie aromat słodki i rześki. Piękny wygląd - złota barwa ukoronowana bujną śnieżnobiałą pianą, ciało mętne. W smaku z jednej strony cytrusy, głównie grejpfrut, z drugiej wyraźne drożdże i słodowość, bardzo fajnie to wszystko wyważone (wywarzone;)). Na finiszu nieco rozgrzewa, przyjmuje też bardziej owocowy charakter. Bardzo dobry, złożony saison

Bouteille achetée à La Mise En Bière - De couleur jaune pâle trouble avec une fine mousse blanche - Au nez des arômes de brett, dabricot, de pêche, légèrement citroné, bien fruité, cake citron, légèrement herbacé, les brett sont très presente sent apporté beaucoup dacidité - En bouche abricot, citroné, brett, herbacé, une bonne amertume, légèrement salée, incroyable de complexité - Corp moyen, amertume moyenne/forte, carbonation pétillante, sèche, final brett herbacé - Vraiment funky, grosse amertume, vraiment incroyable

Keg at Craven Arms, Birmingham. That unmistakable Saison taste. Or is it the Brett that gives it the unique mouthexcitement? It probably is. Chalk tone, matchstick structure, lime/tic tac sour twist. Really good. Straight.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow, with a short lived creamy head. Aroma is fruity hops with pineapple, nice bretty notes, peppery grassy notes, wood and salt. Full body, with average carbonation. Flavour is dry, with perfumey brett with some wooden notes and citrusy hops with orange peel.

On tap at Whats Brewing 2015, day 2. Hazy golden body with atiny white head, Aroma is bretty with zesty grapefruit and peach, mild barnyard. Superdry and fresh citric taste, sour, with a funky nudge. Excellent refreshing finish that leaves you craving for more.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2016 (50 cl bottle in wine glass.) Pours hazy yellow with a large white two finger head. The aroma instantly fills the room with fruits and that distinct farmhouse bouquet. I find some banana, pine and semi-tropical fruits. The taste is wonderful! Very light and fizzy, which I am not really into. But the taste are really clear and diverse. Licorice and banana (classic combination from my bartender days) with a tingling bitterness. Good one :)

Golden yellow colour. High white head. Hay, grass, woody, hints of brett in the aroma. Grassy, flowery notes at first. Slight caramel, hints of leather. Really crisp. Dry, bitter finish. Woody, grassy notes in the aftertaste. Very well balanced, light bodied, absolutly fabolous beer. Superb.

Bottle, 0.50l. Pours hazy clay like color with large frothy white head, yeast residue and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of citrus, brett, funk, wheat, leather, seaweed, salt and some grass. Taste starts light sweet grainy, following is citric, funky and slightly salty, mouthfeel is spicy warming with moderate bitter finish. Medium body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Excellent drinkability without any alcohol trace despite 8.1% ABV...

Bottle from Firma Bier, medium sample. Hazy golden color, medium frothy head. Lovely aroma of funky Brett, bubblegum, fruity hop, bit citrus, slight grainy wheat. Soft sourness in taste, funky, citrus. Wonderful stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2016 Bottle shared by Caesar, thanks! Clear (initially) golden color, average sized white head. Smell and taste wheat, brett, typical saison yeast, soft fruitpeel bitter. Decent body and carbonation.

Milky straw yellow body, large foamy white head. Aroma is pineapple, farmhouse funk, straw, red berries and hints of citrus and wet grass. Taste is grapefruit, red berries, straw, pale malts and hints of bitter herbs and hay. Medium body, high carbonation. Promising aroma, but the flavors are a bit flat. OK, but no more.
Pours clear pale straw color with big white head. Aromas of brett, grass, and citrus with a hint of dough. Brett and grass flavors with hints of lemon and dough. Medium body with average carbonation.

Bottle. Moderate to heavy hay, grain and straw for the malt, moderate grass for the hops, heavy barnyard and damp mustiness for the yeast, with notes of apple, allspice and a hint of white wine. Head is huge, frothy turning rocky, white with excellent lacing and is fully lasting. Color is murky yellow/amber. Flavor starts slightly sweet and moderately to heavily acidic, then finishes moderately acidic and lightly bitter. Palate is medium, slick with a lively to fizzy carbonation and a dry finish. Great Saison with perfect balance between mellow and wild.

Une bière blanche avec cette gigantesque mousse brettée. Au nez, agrumes, pain et band-aid. Je narrive pas à aimer ce genre de notes médicales. Au goût, tout saméliore. Les houblons et les levures sauvages apportent un fruité certainement intéressant. En bouche, le corps léger et aérien facilite labsorption. La finale sèche me rappelle la Farmhouse Houblon du Castor.

July 26, 2015. On tap at Blind Tiger Ale House. 
Cloudy yellow with a large creamy white head. Aroma is overripe fruits with pawpaw, pineapple, mango, citrus, funk, barnyard and some earthy spicy notes. Taste is sweet fruity, funky, slight citric. Finish is light to medium dry bitter with a citrusy pith note, some grass and earthy spices, light tart note and some sweet fruits and funk. Medium bodied, slightly dry, soft to average carbonation.

Tasting session @ Budapest.

Pours a pale yellow with a nice white head. Nose is lemon citrus, wet grass and funky. Taste is great. Lemon, funk, subtle hops, fruity, spicy. Quality drop on a summer evening

(Bottle) Pours a clear yellow body with a medium white head. Aroma of horse blanket, citrus, apple, straw, and pineapple. Flavor of brett, citrus, bread, and pepper with a soft mouthfeel and a dry finish.
Bottle. Golden color, normal foam. Aroma: brett, a little wildness, pear and something else, sour. Taste: very wild, sulfur, fruit, acididy, weird.
Bottle shared by Bvery, thanks buddy! Cloudy yellow pour, foamy white head. Amazing citrus funk aroma. Taste has more hops than Id like. Bitter finish. Really interesting and good.
Bottle. This is unreal. Funny citrus yeasty aroma. Money. Crisp bright palate - citrus sweet with a hop edge. Damn, this is so good.

Bottle. Pours clody yellow with medium thick white head. Aroma: sourish, citruswheat, white bread, hay, juicy, fresh hay with flowers. Taste: almoost medium bitter, malty, yeasty, stayed hay, Medium body.
A: Cloudy light yellow with some brown notes and a white head. N: Cilantro, lemon, brett, farmhouse T: Orange, honeydew, passionfruit O: Lots of brett and fruityness. Quite nice.

500ml bottle from Craft Beer Cabin. Aroma: great nose of funky citrus, lemon, spices, floral. App: hazy pale  with green tint, huge white head quickly making room for a small medium white with big bubbles lacing covering my glass. Taste and palate: light to medium body, moderate high carbonation tingling the tongue, moderate lingering acidity and refreshing dry finish. Overall: well made. Something in this aroma that reminds me of all Crooked Stave aroma, probably from the brett strain. Refreshing and easy to drink. Something to drink by the pool.

Une couche de mousse à première vue entêtée se distance toutefois rapidement dun liquide marécageux aux accents blonds et pâles.
Des fruits jaunes mûrs, telle que la poire, soutiennent des notes lactiques évidentes. Des vestiges de pin et dagrumes gracieuseté dun houblonnage qui était sans aucun doute plus insistant jadis viennent complexifier un bouquet fort prometteur.
La bête sauvage est docile en bouche, grâce une gazéification ample qui transporte très bien les saveurs fruitées vers une finale délicatement saline qui colle sur les lèvres. Complexe, mais si facile à boire

Bottle 
Hazy pale yellow white foam 
Aroma of apricot stable, parfume
Taste sweet bitter, apricot, synthetic 
Nice texture

Bottle. 
Pours hazy golden with a huge white head. 
A light funky aroma with some citrus. 
Balanced brew with a taste of barnyard, apricot and oranges.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours hazy Golden with a small creamy white head. Aroma of citrus weak farmhouse and funk. Taste is well balanced , weak sourish, citrus and weak salt. Filling and creamy mouthfeel. Very good and moreish beer.
Bottle thanksto Todd . Pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium white head. A big fruity lemon funk nose. The flavor is light lemon, biscuit, huge funky dusty brett. Very nice.

24.10.2015, tap @ Whats Brewing:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh funky, mild brett, citrus peel, old leafs, minerals, citrus, grass, hay, hops. Taste is slightly sweet sour-ish, mild brett, weeds, citrus peel, oak, weeds, minerals, grass, fresh wood, hay. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Aroma: citrus, spice, salt
Taste: spice, citrus, fruity, banana, candy
Would have liked more funk, but still good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden pour, foamy white head. Nose is citrusy hops, salt, tart. Taste is citrus, some salt, bitter finish.

Bottle, 1 pint 9 fl.oz. Home. A sparkling golden yellow beer with a big white foamy head ; good retention. Intense fruits (citrus like lime and grapefruit, red berries), herbs, light resin, acid woody note ; light peper. Light sweet, medium dry bitter ; light acidulating refreshing. Medium body, silky texture, good carbonation, fruity bitter fresh acid finish finish. Overall, delicious beer ; very fruity hoppy ; light acid ; balanced ; nice silky texture.

500 ml Bottle. Bright yellow color with slow dying head. Aroma is light citrus, mild rustic grain and a mega shit ton of Brettanomyces. Notes of band aides and barnyard funk. 
The flavor is very weak citrus, barnyard funky notes, hints of band aides. Its seems like the Brett C is taking over the flavors. Drink them if you got them because I really think if it is held any longer, it will be a mess. So far still pretty good but turning in the other direction.
Aroma is citrus funk. Incredibly hazy golden colour with a thin yet massively persistent head. Taste is quite hopped for a farmhouse brew. Fantastic.

Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is funky with musty cellar notes, a bit of tartness and some sweet vanilla notes. Taste starts funky, slightly tart and quite bitter and hoppy. Aftertaste is slightly sweet. Body is on the heavy side but also well carbonated. Overall its a quite nice brett beer. Funky, hoppy, bitter and tasty.

Ámbar limpio y abundante espuma blanca compacta. Aromas cítricos de brett, manzana dulce, hierba fresca, pino. Cuerpo medio bien carbonatado, sabor se manzana verde, cítricos, pino y final de amargor seco largo.

Aromat: Owoce tropikalne oraz dzikość.
Wygląd: Bursztynowe, mętne, z piękną, trzymającą się pianą.
Smak: Znów mamy do czynienia z owocami (mango, marakuja), które są delikatne i świetnie wkomponowane w piwo, Całość nabiera wspaniałego kremowego ciała, pijalności na dobrym poziomie. Na posmaku wchodzi delikatna kwasowość wraz z dzikością drożdży. Do tego przyjemna mineralność. Zdecydownie warto.

Aroma is immediately hitting me. Beautifully citrusy yet super funky and bready. Aroma is the best part with this. Large white head hazy golden body with a medium heavy carb. Sweet taste. Bready and funky. A little bitter in the end.

On tap at The Bottle Shop London. Hazy bright gold lasting white head. Bretty peachy aroma. Some Sherbet hop. Brett dominates with some lovely fresh fruit salad. Proper funky Brett too. Quite entertaining. Tropical sweet fruit mango and passion fruit. OK.

Hazy golden with a big white head. The aroma has great citrus hops with overtones of melon and pineapple, along with well suited fruity and funky brett character. Dry, fruity and funky flavour with a medium bitter finish. Outstanding beer, in a genre that often disappoints
Bottle - Tons of funk and nice citrus notes. Clear gold with a rich white head. Tons of farmhouse notes, citrus, stone fruit and a real funky but light bodied finish. Very well done.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a white big head. Spicy, bretty, funky with some of the fruitiness from the hops coming through on the aroma. Taste is dry with some hints of the sea salt, light sourness and some bitterness from the hops. Body is medium with high carb. Great!
Bottle. Hazy golden with white head. Massive sharp bret aroma as expected, funky, sharp, lemon, pineapple. Taste of pineapple, lemon, pepper. Dry and tart. Nice

Shared 16.9 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy golden-orange. Gigantic foamy white head with good retention. Aroma is fruity, earthy, citrus, pine, and funk with some floral and spice notes. Tastes of grapefruit, citrus pine, spice, funk, and barnyard with a dash of Pine-Sol thrown in. Has some tartness. Good.

Aroma: sweet, citrusy with distinct funkiness; Appearance: billowy head with large bubbles that takes up most of the glass before dissipating; light straw with haze; Taste: spicy, crisp; sweet around the edges; delicious; Palate: medium body with long, funky, bitter finish; Overall: very complex and delicious; would definitely buy again.
Good wet towel aroma. Some hops. Flavor is a great blend of the yeast flavors from the aroma and hops. Very cloudy yellow body on a huge head. Bubbly but not intense carbonation.

Bottle, Pours golden with massive large head. Too carbonated. Notes are belgian classical with pepper, heavy Brett and oak. Really straight forward without tartness. the blandness of claussennii killed off any citra or hoppy notes.

Piana dość duża, początkowo drobna, szybko zmienia się w grubą, mydlaną, szybko opada do chmurki. Barwa jasno pomarańczowa, mocno zmętniona, wręcz mleczna. Aromat świetny - wyraźna dzikość, bretty połączone z amerykańskim chmielem - stajnia, siano i derka miesza się z limonką, grejpfrutem i iglakami. Klasa! W smaku również super - fajna cytrusowość, fajna baza słodowa, nieco pszeniczno-weizenowa z zaznaczonym bananem, jest też trochę estrów i fenoli (brzoskwinia, przyprawy). Całość przyprawiona subtelną końską derką i saisonowymi ziołami. Goryczka niska, pasująca do całości. W afterteasie echa morskiej soli. Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, duża pijalność, ale i niemała mączna treściwość, fajna szorstkość na języku. Alkohol sprawia wrażenie o połowę niższego.
Wyśmienite piwo, które trudno jednoznacznie zakwalifikować do konkretnego stylu. Z jednej strony przypomina nachmielonego American Witbiera, z drugiej przyprawowego Saisona, z trzeciej Wild Ale z brettami. Pijalność spora, alkohol praktycznie niewyczuwalny!

First and foremost- what a cool bottle. Pours a pale yellow with a nice white head. Nose is lemon citrus, wet grass and funky. Taste is great. Lemon, funk, subtle hops, fruity, spicy. Quality drop on a summer evening

500 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 6/18/2015. Pours lightly hazy golden straw color with a 2-3 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big lemon, orange, grapefruit, peach, pineapple, mango, apricot, pear, apple, pepper, hay, straw, wheat, cracker, musty funk, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy/funky yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, orange, grapefruit, peach, pineapple, mango, apricot, pear, apple, pepper, hay, straw, wheat, cracker, musty funk, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Moderate peppery yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, orange, grapefruit, peach, pineapple, mango, apricot, pear, apple, pepper, wheat, cracker, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy/funky yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from carbonation and yeast spice. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, fairly creamy/bready, and lightly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent hoppy brett saison style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy/funky yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and moderate pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
Bottle from Voldby. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, fruits, malt, citrus, flowers and hops. Nice fruity finish.

Hazy light golden, thin bubbly ringed head. Nose is creamy funk, melon and grass. Initial taste is creamy grapefruit, waxy citrus and loose breadiness. Carbonation is solid and mouthfeel lean and gummy. Finishes lean creamy tropical fruit, lingers rich and grassy. Two Kay baby. Bottle, Two Kay Tasting de la Comely Bankers Draught
Very cloudy and gold in appearance. Marmalade, apricot and citrus on the nose. Light and refreshing on the palate. with more fresh fruit.
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden. Nose is sour, orange, marmalade, lemon. Taste is sweet and sour, orange, citrus, funk, herbs. Nnice.

Bottle thanks to those guys.
Appearance - cloudy golden with not much head as such.
Nose - thick shred marmalade. Tangy sour.
Taste - more of the same.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a long dry tangy finish.
Overall -
Bottle at appellation. Pours hazy yellow, nose is citrus, toffee, oak, taste is juicy fruit, sweet, vanilla, dry.
Bottle Appellation Wines, Comely Bankers Draught tasting. Pours hazy gold with a thin white head. Aromas of brett, sherbet. Taste is sour orange, sherbet. Dry, crisp finish.

I just cant help myself. I love the earthy stink of Brett-focused brews. Brett Cs got a healthy dose of it and enhances that dankness even further with the inclusion of Cascade and Citra hops. The salt adds a slightly savory quality to a brew that has lots of funkiness and barnyard aromas. For all the wild yeast notes, Brett C is an approachable beer. Not all Saisons make Brett palatable for the uninitiated, but Brett C does a fine job at it.

Flaske. Nytårsaften sent ude, men altid det bedste til sidst. Lysegul uklar øl med masser af Brett og let surhed i duften. Smagen er frisk med en umiddelbar Brett der går over i en lækker surhed der komplimenterer godt. Super øl.

Pours hazy medium yellow with average frothy head. Aroma is straw, lemon, peach, pineapple, lots of barnyard, rustic, sweat. Taste is also good, but more on the bitter side of things. Semi-dry finish with some minerals and salt. Nice soft palate. Another stellar Prairie saison.

Bottle.

A- Funky, strong barnyard, horse blanket.

A- Golden color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Barnyard, funky, tart, yeasty.

P-Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, funky finish.

O- Brett is what this beer is all about. Tons of that musty dirty barnyard aroma and taste. Dont get any sea salt or anything else. Just lots of Brett. Im sure Brett is a nice fellow but I dont like him in my beer.

Bottle from craft beer cellar A: mango, pineapple, leathery, citrusy app: clear pale frothy white head. T/p: thin body with light acidic finish. Fizzy. O: another fine creation by prairie. Nice fruitiness from the hops and yeast with a thin body makes for a really easy to drink ale. Would definitely buy again if it cross my path..

Huge meringue like pillowy head that lasts forever. Translucent yellow color. Absolutely awesome aroma of Bretty funk and a hint of citra hiding behind it. The flavor is a bit of Brett cherry pie then hops then Brett bitterness. Ultra dry finish with a bit of a fizzy mouthfeel. Great beer that I just tossed down.

Bottle. Gold with a large white head that fades to a lasting coat. Aroma of mandarins, medicinal herbal Meyer lemon, hay, peach, low acid pineapple. Summery with moderate but quite phenolic funk. The aroma is interesting and edging up to the rustic/ mildly offensive border. The taste doesnt live up to that promise, but its not dull. Sweet with hay, tropical fruit, citrus, some pepper. Bitterness is perhaps a little lower than expected and its a bit spicy but not all that dry. Good, but would have liked it drier/ more bitter/ less sweetly fruity (pick one or more) at the end.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy gold with a large, frothy white head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is heavy phenolic notes of bandage, light smoke, earthy Brettanomyces, wheat and cereal malt with earthy and spicy hops. Flavor is lightly tart farmhouse yeast, phenolic Brettanomyces, earthy wheat malt, light earthy and spicy hops and medium bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and heavy carbonation.

500 ml bottle poured into a teku glass. The beer is a hazy yellow with a big head of white foam. The haze disappeared quickly and the head diminished at a moderate rate. The aroma has a lot of grassy and herbal notes. I get some green tea-type character as well. Very herbal beer. The taste lends more of a bitterness than anything else. Low level of funk that never really gets sour. I dont pick up on a salt note either. Medium body and medium to high carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 kran w jabeer. bardzo jasne z nieimponujaca piana. w aromatach sa i brety i cytrusy (cytryna chyba najbardziej o dziwo), i saisonowosc i tej soli chyba troszeczke faktycznie, i jakas kwiatowosc... calosc jest tak ulozona, ze daje niezwykle rzeskie wrazenie, kwaskowate, slodkawe... mieszanka zaiste kosmiczna :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity bretty citrus aroma. Fruity malty bretty citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty bretty citrus hoppy finish.

Hazy gold with a creamy white head. The aroma is quite spectacular. It has a lot of pineapple, mango, grapefruit, brett funk, and a little bit of alcohol. The flavor is a lot tamer. There is some sweet malt, brett funk, and some light citra and cascade on the back end. Finishes dry, with a touch of sweetness and a bit of salt. Not bad.
Awesome aroma. Light refreshing lemon. Taste doesn't follow up with the aroma. Bubbly. Foggy. Wish it tasted like it smells.
On tap at Uiltje, Haarlem. Fresh, fruity aroma, lemon, yeast, barnyard, funk. Taste is bitter sweet, lemon, funk, yeast, malt. Dry ending, bitter yeasty aftertaste. Nice.

2015/16 New Years beer no. 5. Bottle thanks to s_hartshorne as Xmas present, cheers Shane. Slightly hazy golden beer with large foaming head. Aroma of yeast, citrus lemon and tropical fruits. Taste is lemon pith, yeast, citrus, some pine resin and barnyard funk. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Tap@ Tapwerks Okc. Hazy golden color with white foam. Dry hay, bandaid, barnyard, citrus, dusty malt aromas. Smooth medium body. Nice bready pale malt, citrusy, dry spice, barnyard piss and dung, dry hay flavors--- very tasty.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Draught @ Whats Brewing - Saturday Session 1, Stavanger
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, brett, mango and yeast. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with a long funky, mango, brett and pineapple finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2017 Pours straw like color, slightly haze, with creamy white, very stable head, which stays untouched till the end. Visually high carbonation. Immediatelly when you open the bottle, you detect hop aroma, which takes on citruses, pine, which is supported with like vinegar acidity, lemon juise and sea salt. 
Flavor: firstly are detectable malt flavors, which takes on biscuit, with hint of toffee, but than immediately prevails hop flavors, which takes on citruses, pine, grapefruit and grape. Finish is lactic tart, at the same time complementary sweet, with pleasant note of sea salt, which flavor lingers long in aftertaste.
Body is medium, texture is unbelivable silky smooth, carbonisation is high.
World class beer!

Bottle thx Thomas. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of Brett, prairie house flavor, hoppy, citrus, grape, funk, light flowery. Taste us funk, hops, citrus, quite bitter light sweet. Dry and bretty finish.
From bottle, Thanks a lot Tomek! Aroma of funk, brett, citrus, floral. Really nice! Taste is lots of brett, smooth, a bit thin, citrus, floral. Not too shabby, but Ive had better from Praire.

Draught. Cloudly, yellow in colour, no head. In aroma brety, funky, citrusy hops, some lemon zest and tart fruits. In taste medium sour, citrusy with salty and bretty notes. Medium to low body, dry ad tart finish. Tasty.
Bottle at tasting. Aroma of funky barnyard and tart. Flavor of mild horseblanket, funky grain, mild salt and a little citrus. Like a lighter US version of Orval.

Bottle at Max & Jesss for an impromptu barbecue thing when I was down for Comic Con.. Pours a hazed gold with a medium sized white head. Big fuzzy musk and citrus on the nose. Soft hay and mango, medium bodied. Light hay, citrus and musk. Dusty hay into the finish, lingering fruit.

500ml bottle. Cloudy, yellow-ish deep golden colour with huge, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Complex, bretty, funky, citrusy hoppy aroma, bretty notes with funky prevalence and widely disguised bubblegum touch, hints of lemon, lemon peel, lemongrass, mustard seed, a floral touch, fruity ground layer with hints of gooseberry, rhubarb, quince, mandarine, unripe peach. Taste is citrusy hoppy, initially minimally salty, dry and tart, with zesty and juicy lemon notes on a generally fruity basis with cautious, subtly sweet sugar powder touch, cushioned bretty notes, hints of peach, quince, grass and white pepper. Manifold and complex, a plethora of self-contained flavours is allowed to appear, to play an autonomous, non-dominating role, thereby anyhow essentially contributing to a total work of art. Did you ever think about the possible style-candidate(s) of your perfect beer with 5.0 score? Do not exclude Saison overhastily from that list!

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy dull golden with a small white head. Aroma of Brett funk, barnyard, sea salt noticeably coming out in the nose, citrus, light fruits and light malt. Flavour is above light sweet and moderate bitter. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Funky aroma. Thin white head. Murky amber/blond pour. Slight saltiness. refreshing

Bottle from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours light, bright gold with a white head. Aroma is earthy/citrus/brett. Med body, likely better. Flavor is brett forward, followed by citrus. Salt? Maybe. Note: bottle is a slow foamer. Its rather clean/citrus/brett refreshing. Id like to say subtle, but the brett is noticeable - and the bottle keeps off-foaming. Pretty tasty ale.

Sample at Daily Growler Powell during the Pumpkin Carving Party on 10/22/2015. Hazy yellow color with a medium thick fluffy white head that diminishes gradually. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, funky yeast and malt. Medium body with flavors of brett yeast, salted citrus ad biscuit malt. The finish is mildly sour with a funky aftertaste. Pretty good overall.
Bottle @ Bullerup Pubbens , Re-Opening/Solar eclipse pt. 2. Clear yellow body with a large white head. Hops, brett, yeast, fruity.

Bottle at The Bullerup Pubben reopening/Solar Eclipse pt. 2 tasting. It pours hazy golden with a fluffy snow white head. The aroma is gooseberry, funky brett, orange peel, mandarin, citrus and grapefruit. Great fruity flavour. Lots of oranges with gooseberry and a nice funky kick.
Bottle @ Bullerup Pubbens , Re-Opening/Solar eclipse pt. 2. Pours cloudy yellow with a frothy white head. Funky nose and flavor. Brett, citrus, barnyard and grass. Awesome! Dryish bitter finish.

Aroma has tons of fruit! Citrus, mango, peach and pineapple. Slight funk! Flavor is on the spot! Slightly salty, fruity, with tons of citrus, peach and mango! Delicious!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours light pale yellow into a tulip. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes leaving pot lacing. Aspirin and funky brett aromas. Sharp with sweet caramel and pepper upfront turning to dry band aid in the medium length finish.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a large off white head with good retention and lace. Nose is bretty; barnyard, grapes, must, over ripe apples. Good. Flavour follows the same lines with brett and some green plant material, wood, some hot alcohol, plastic. Medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation, light sweet and medium bitter. I would probably like it more if the alcohol was lower, too sharp as it is.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with a lasting foamy white head. Aroma of lemon, hay, bread, white grapes, oranges. Taste is of lemon, orange, grapefruit, floral, some spice, brown sugar. Lovely.

The aroma is grapefruit, grass, hay, earth, Brett funk, mineraly yeast notes, and a little Golden Delicious. Foamy head and a correspondingly bubbly mouthfeel. The taste is moderate bitter and medium sour, with mineraly, earthy, citrusy flavors and a dry, tangentially fruity finish. Some saltiness shows up on the back of the palate, too.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden yellow pour with a thin white head, aroma has apricot along with funky lemon, taste has metallic brett action, some peach, citrus, ok,

Poured into a teku showing cloudy opaque neon yellow with two fingers of white foam. 

The nose shows a good intensity of grapefruit and cannabis with a farmhouse background. 

The palate is well carbonated and light bodied. Farmhouse flavor shows prominently in the background with the very light pine and grapefruit flavor throughout. Mid palate of light tartness. Bitterness from the hops also plays a big role as it shows through the whole beer. Finish returns back to the bitterness.

Bottle 500ml. [ As Prairie Brett C. ].Unclear matt medium yellow color with a average, frothy and open, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, pale malt, moderate hoppy, herbs, citrus, grape, light to moderate yeasty, leather, brett. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet, light acidic and moderate bitter with a long duration, brett, barnyard, citrus, tart, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150811]

On tap at Whats Brewing 2015
Milky yellow, white head. Smell of funk, barnyard, grapes and hops, some fruity esters. Light sweet, quite hoppy, alot of funky flavor, quite dry, fruity. Moderate bitter finish. Very nice

A hazy, a light yellow beer, a head is huge and white. Strong bubbling in the glass. Aroma has green apples, lether, generic fruitness, citrusfruits. Very refreshning and pleasant aroma. Taste is earthy and nicely sour, fruitness, apples and some bananas, some citrusfruity bitterness in the end. Medium bodied, strong carbonation that nicely fitts into this beer. Great and tasteful beer. Strong sourness is perfectly balanced with other elements and even the sourness is powerful it isnt dominating.

On Draught! 
Had this a bunch of times now, its one of my favorite beers thats come out this year, but I never took notes on it till just the other day. 

The beer pours a very hazy yellow with a big fluffy white head and lots of lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is bright citrus at first but then follows with a bunch of wet limestone... lime zest, mild musty funkiness. Just all sorts of fruity, weird, inviting, bright yet dank... totally aromatic in a big way. 

The flavor is fruity, pineapple, lemon, orange, and some lime zest. Its got a great minerallity, its fairly dry but a good ways from anything Id call "bone" dry. Its got a mild but very well integrated bitterness throughout. Just lots of bright hops, a little floral character, a touch of light alcohol spiciness. Overall extraordinarily cohesive. 

The beer is prickly and dances on the tongue, the dryness and bitterness of the flavor add a lovely sensation when paired with this sort of carbonation. 

A great beer, and this is coming from someone who is normally not a great fan of brett beers that only use this particular strain.
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy golden with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are lemons, brett, and flowers - with a dry finish. High drinkability

Man, this is so good; maybe the best sour Ive ever had. Pours with a huge frothy long lived head. Aroma is a lemony citrus, tart, something - yeast? bitter. Flavors the best thing here. All of the aroma qualities intensified and the carbonation adds to it all in the in the most pleasurable way. Such a satisfying beer.

Pours murky "dirty" yellow with tall white head. Aroma of bretta, elderflower, citrus, light funk, apricot, apples. Amazing. Taste is crisp, fresh, light tart with a mellow honey sweet and light funky finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation. Another stellar performer by Prairie - these guys are killing it right now!

From 500ml bottle. 
L: pours a hazy straw gold with a big white fluffy head, plenty of creamy bubbly lacing. The final pour was cloudy murky pear juice. 
S: a divine up front aroma of citrus and floral hops, Belgian yeast, sea salt traces, and lightly funky at first, that gets funkier. 
T: nicely spiced and peppery up front, plays well with the citrus, a bit funky on the end. The final pour gets funked out more than a Parliament record. 
F: insanely easy to drink, very crisp and dry, lingering spice, gently carbonated, no alcohol feel but good flavour. 
O: I loved how each pour got murkier and funkier. A great brett ale, it tools twists and turns and displayed equally enjoyable citrus/floral hop and funky spicy farmhouse attributes.

Pale golden with a thick white head. Aroma is light spice, coriander in particular. Flavor is light, dry with a bit of coriander as well. Slightly tart and funky in the finish, but lightly so. Very solid.

(500ml bottle from kihoskh.dk) Pours hazy medium gold with a fairly large bubbly white head that fades without lace. Aroma has a core of fresh juicy mango, mandarin, pineapple, yuzu, grapefruit peel and peach, a moderate funky cheesy Brett profile, slight elements of wet hay, salt and white pepper. Palate is built on a softly sweet pale malt core with peach prominent, mixed citrus peels, apricot, light pineapple, a bit of banana smoothie at the start, kiwi towards the finish. This is augmented by floral notes, a fairly light barnyard funk and a little grain. Finish is dry with lingering floral/citrus peel hop bitterness, a bit of lingering funk and some light brine. Salt noticeable in the aftertaste. Light to medium body with brisk carb and no hint of the higher alcohol. Wow, really nice one from Prairie, the Brett claus here is more fruity than dirty like a lot of funky farmhouses are. Nice body and mix of flavours, complex, drinkable; an interesting and refreshing brew.
Bottle from Biercab Shop. Hazy golden colour with big white head. Yeast, citric, funky aroma. Yeast, citric, funky taste. Medium body.

16.9 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of Brett, citrus fruit and peel, funk, tropical fruit. Tastes of citrus fruit and peel, tropical fruit, Brett, light funk, earthy and floral notes. Medium-light body with a pretty dry finish. Very tasty.
Pours a golden yellow with big fizzy head. Aromas of wine, yeast, & some funk. Smooth yeasty taste with a touch of the funk.

AU nez ça schlingue la brett ... Littéralement. Au goût, et bien on est dans lécurie. ça goûte le cuir et la bouse ... Cest donc une très bonne bière de ferme, quon se le dise. Pas mal citronnée dailleurs avec des notes de poivre aussi.
Nice beer! Hazy gold, funky stone fruit aroma. Taste had the big brett, nice citrus, tart bite. Well balanced with that distinctive prairie house yeast (I guess at least), good stuff

Hazy golden color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of vanilla, toast, brett, cherry, citrus. Taste of toast, citrus, vanilla, tropical fruits, and a slightly tart, wild finish.

Pours cloudy lemon with a creamy beige head. Body is very effervescent and needs a swirl for sure. The aroma brings sweet unique earthy dirt Brett yeast and almost a lime spritz. The flavor brings a tart and lightly tangy profile with again a unique Brett yeast, especially from a earthy tweak in the twang.

Bottle. Clear golden color with a light white head. Alcohol funky citrus aroma. Light carbonated body. Spicy citrus tart flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nose is leather, pineapple, light pepper, sweet citrus. Flavor is same plus unripe banana and mango, grainy sweetness, very faint brine. Frothy, mildly briney, musty/rustic mouthfeel. Long funky, dry finish.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours hazy golden with a frothy dense head. Notes of passion fruit, some stone fruit, some funk, floral and a fairly bitter finish.

Bottle at home. Deep fruity bretty nose. Almost a malty boozy sweetness. Taste is nice and bretty, herbal and dry with light hop character. Little sweetness again then fruity hoppy dryness. Lots happening here. Great as ever from Prairie.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours hazy light yellow with a medium head. Aromas of citrus, lemon zest, brett, stone fruits, light hops and some floral notes. The aroma on this is soooo nice! Taste has the same citrussy notes to it, mango, pineapple, some tart stone fruits, funky, lemon zest with a dry and floral finish. Damn, this is good!

[7555-20150815] Bottle. Floral herbs and sweet grass aroma. Hazy, pale white yellow body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Bitter toasted grass and herbs flavour. Medium body. Good, nice yeastiness. (8/3/8/4/15) 3.8
(@ Campground Brewdown 2015, Millmont, PA)
Bottle. Hazy gold. Bright, Light, crisp, refreshing, funky, citrusy, creamy. Very good

Hazy straw yellow, bog off-white head. Nose is fruity, barnyard funk, brett, wheat, citric and sweet notes. Flavor is lemons, wheat, brett, lemon peel, funk. Hoppy and bitter finish, light acidity. Very crisp and refreshing, hides the ABV well. Nice one.

Bottle. Pours golden with huge whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is fruits, apricots, citrus, lemon, funk. Flavor is sweet and somewhat bitter, fruity, citrus, apricot, tartness. Finish is dry with some citrus. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great brew.

Pours hazy golden with low white head
Aromas of citrusy fruits, bretta, funk, barnyard, sour green apples, hints of over ripe fruits
Taste nice of funk, stable, citrus, sour grapes, apples, herbs

Cloudy yellow color. Frothy white head. Very big bretty nose with tons of cracked pepper, wheat, lemon and salt. Wow. Great nose. Light-medium body with good carbonation, decent Brett character. Refreshing and funky. Lots of Brett and a very good saison. Lovely stuff.
Bottle. Glowing murky gold with a thick white head. Citrus and tropical fruits with plastic and barnyard-like funk. Light creamy mouthfeel and spritzy carb. Very good.

Bottle sample at a sour tasting at Noams office. Thanks zvikar. Cloudy yellow with a white head. Great aroma with brett and lots of citric and slightly tropical hops. Flavor is quite dry, with a faint sweetish note, funk, bitterish fruity hops. Medium-bodied. Very good.
Bottle thanks to Matt, a very dry and bretty saison. Close to anchorage style, hops add some citrus and tropical flavors to the mix. Didnt get any saltyness though.

Bottle at home - thanks to Mette. Murkey golden - white head. Citrus. Fresh bretty. Wheaty. Light oatey notes. White sugar like sweetness. Soapy. Light zesty. Salty touch. Light perfumed. Pomela. Light bitterness. Lovely.

Bottle (500 ml). Clear yellow golden with a small white head, good retention, leaving some lacing. Aroma is amazing with a great mix of herbal brettanomyces, hay, mineral notes, white wine and mild spiciness, all in a perfect balance. Taste is also perfectly balance with herbal brettanomyces, mineral notes, white wine character and a great juicy tropical fruits presence. Body is medium. Carbonation is medium, making mouthfeel really fluffy. Dry finish. Extremely drinkable and quenching. Perfect balance. Amazing stuff from Prairie again!

Bright hazy yellow with a firm white head. Aroma is pure brett, dust, attic, leaves. Mouthfeel is dry, a bit heavy for the style, slick texture with fizzy carbonation, a bit high on acidity. Astringent finish. Really good but a bit too high on everything.

Bottle. Unclear yellow in color with a frothy whitish head. Citrus, herbal greens, apple and funkyness in aroma. 
Citrus and biscuit with some hay in taste. The barnyard notes appears later on. Tart notes and some funky grapefruityness in finish. Solid one.

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a hazy yellow with a big, frothy, white head. Aroma has lots of brett, citrus peel, hops, citra-sweet citrus fruits, slight hard cheese. Taste is surprisingly smooth, probably because of the abv. Lots of dry brett, slight bitter hops, slight breadish sweetness. High cacrbonation and smooth body. Alcohol still well hidden though. Not bad!

Pours a pretty hazy golden with a medium white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is almost exclusively of bandaids to me. Some fruitiness as well but mostly bandaids. Taste is dry and fruity, showcases brett nicely. Earthy finish. Body is medium and carbonation too. Overall I thought it was nice but it didnt resonate with me that much. I can think of quite a few brett beers Id have before that one. Still a worthy experience, though.

Blonde moelleuse à grumeaux avec un aspect savonneux proéminent, tout pour plaire dans ce type de bière fermière. Le jus de mangue/banane transporte des pulpes sauvages et amères dans une sensuelle machabilité.

bottle shared by tom10101, many thanks bro. pours cloudy very pale golden with a small creamy white cap, reviving and leaving good lacing. mineral bretts, woodsy vanilla, light catpee, dill, white wine, peppery white grapes, bitter herbs, sizzling cherries. bright and smooth carbonation - which is welcomingly odd; light body; dry woodsy-spicy-citrusy finish. rustic and juicy. excellent!

Bottle shared. Clear gold pour with small lacy foamy white head. Aroma is really, really good, pineapple, great grassy, almost woody notes, very fruity, peach, white wine, light sauvignon notes,bretty. Taste is very nice, nice funky character, light tartness, bready, nice winey character. Palate is light bodied, very dry, med carbonation, very soft. Very good.

Bottle I brought to Max and Jesss housearming. Pours a bright, golden yellow body with thick white lacing. Aroma is bright fresh brett, tart yeast and pepper spice. Mouthfeel is medium, tart and zesty with notes of sour lemon, bitter hop, pine/dank hop profile, fresh yeast and funky brett. Nice sour saison.
Crisp gold with a white head. Nose is Brett, funk, horseblanket and dry. Smooth palate, heavy Brett, funky, dry, burlap and a nice finish

Bottle. Poured hazy yellow color with a large frothy white head that was lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy sour, earthy and citrus hop aroma. Medium body with a sticky dry texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour & bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy sour & bittersweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where exceeded.

Aroma: sour, yeast, apples, cider, citrus. Appearance: hazy, pale gold, massive, frothy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters continue, sour apple, grain malts, brett, light tart. Overall: very nice Saison, good palate. Pint at CBC, Clapham.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours light yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, brett, light spice, fruit, pineapple, citrus, lemon. Flavor is malt, nice brett, little spice, fruity hops, peach, pineapple, light tartness, citrus. Medium body, average carboantion, light bitter finish. 091015

Tap @ Fermentoren . Pours hazy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma of fresh citrusy hops. Lots of orange, weak passion, pineapple and some funky brett. Also some dry straw notes and weak herbs. The taste is hoppy with some tart funky notes. Also some lemon, grapefruit, orange and some herbal notes along with the salt that gives it a fresh touch. Body is rather carbonated and juicy.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2016 Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 8.1%. Hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, brett, lemon, hops and citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, brett, littlr dry, lemon, citrus, hops, little grapefruit, little sweet, peach and medium bitter.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 Tap/bottled. Cloudy pale golden body with an average lacing white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, peach and citrusy notes and brett. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and a little tart and pleasant bitter. Light to medium bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation. A crisp, hoppy and very nice Saison indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, bretty and rather hoppy - citrus and fruity. Flavor is quite sweet, rather bitter and light acidic. Dry, moderate bitter and light acidic finish. 091015

The beer is a relatively pale yellow. Its clouded through. Very large white head. The bottle slowly bubbled over upon opening. Some lacing. A bit fizzy and most of the bubbles fade away after puffing up. The aroma is dusty with light brett fruitiness. Light citrus, tangeriney hoppiness. Some pineapple, peach, grape, mango stuff knocking around from the brett, but its pretty mild. The beer has that dusty dry farmhouse aroma that crops up in a lot of brett beers. Taste is quite dry with some more pleasant fruit from the yeast, somewhat bland hop bitterness and a dusty, woody character. The finish is a bit bland. Gentle, full feel. Its light but soft. Its a nice enough experiment, but the Mikkeller yeast series showed off the yeast character a bit better. Strictly as a beer, its just a a sorta boring brett farmhouse ale. I like it, but the overriding taste is light bitterness and brett dryness, and it doesnt really stand out or make me want more.

Sample at the Daily Growler Powell on 9/19/15. Pours clear gold with a thick white head. Aroma of funky brett, lemon, citrus and pine. Funky brett flavor with sweet orange and bitter grapefruit accents before a lemony and slightly salty finish.

Tap. Craft Beer Co, Clapham. 2nd October. Cloudy, dark yellow. Thin, lasting, dense, white head. Lemony brett. Soft vanilla. Straw, hay type funk. Some orange zest. Taste is crisp bitter. Light dry. Some orange sweetness. Smooth, massaging palate. Finishes sharp, crisp bitter. Soft dry close.

Bottle. Thanks to mike12da. Stinky citrusy nose, manure and flowers growing out of it, a sharp Citra bit. Very light yellow/greenish color, with a constant thin off-white head. Big citrus rush in initial, rotting grapefuit, small dose of sauerkraut, persistent bittering in mid and final. Thi-medium body. Wow! Exceptional Bretty nose and great fruit flavors.

500 ml bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a cloudy golden color witha medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have big citrus, lemon, grapefruit, with a nice Brett character, mild funk, light bitterness to the finish, nice drinking beer.

Keg at Route CBC. Opaque bright amber, big white foam head. Nose is acidic, sour, lemon and grapefruit, white wine vinous, cereal husk musty, Brett funk, slight horse blanket, wood barrel. Dominated by acidic notes. Taste is bitter sour citrous acidic, grapefruit rind. Really hard crackling acidic.

Keg at route CBC, London. hazy pale straw color with large white head. Aroma is funky dry white wine grass grapefruit horse blanket. Taste is dry white wine brett white wine funk white grapes grapefruit. Overall, great

This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a glossy to hazy glazed over looking bright yellow to burnt orange color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute. Lacing speckled the glass nicely.
The smell started off with light citrus smacking some spicy peppercorn and then some sweet and bitter pine. Orange enters in as it warms. Bitter rind-like features blend to balance. Light "brett"-like sour features blend to boot.
Moves toward a sweet lemon-esque aroma as it continues to warm.
The taste was moderately sweet allowing an ample amount of sour and a nice underscore of bitterness all developing together through lemon, orange and then leading into the spiciness of the peppercorn to balance. Theres a semi-sweet to slight sour citrus aftertaste.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium with a semi-nice sessionability about it. Since the "sour" level is fairly tame in this one, this could definitely be crushable on those hot days.
Overall, I liked it for me, though I didnt get the "sea salt" in it, this is a good saison, yeah, Id have it again.

Bottle split at GBBF 15, day 1, 11/08/15 big thanks to Fly for bringing us this Juan over.
Hazed orange with a decent off white covering. 
Nose is pissy citrics, musty wood, lemon zip, Brett fumes.
Taste comprises barnyard, funk, dungy brett strokes, bitter orange, lemon rind, damp hay. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, pissy brett manure licks in the close. 
Solid bretted affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Looks almost like pulpy pineapple juice. Nose is bluntly tropical fruity, with both the hops and the brett shining through, and the salt comes through gently on a palate that is lively and quite well-attenuated. This is at once a sipping saison for ponderous moments and a jolly good time summer beer. Really, just fantastic.

Hazy yellow. Smells like urine, old towel, lemon. Dry, medium bitterness, medium-low acidity (from the malt? I dont think this is made with any LAB). Tastes like lemon, grapefruit, the funk from a funky cheese (without the cheese part). Very well hidden alcohol. Extremely refreshing. Seems like it would go very well with intensely flavored rich foods.

Lovely. Again digging the hop/brett/funk combo. This one delivers. Beautiful citrus and slight funk nose with a bouquet of fruity brett. Taste follows and the carbonation delivers with some sharpness.

500 mL bottle poured into a cervoise. Pours clear until I let the sediment flow in. Then its murky as hell. Oops. Big white head with excellent retention. Smell is doughy malts, citrusy hops. Grapefruit from the cascade is dominant. Citra seems to blend into the brett aroma of tropical fruit. A little bit of lemon that hints at acidity. Taste doesnt deliver much, if any acidity, though. Doughy and bready malts lend a bit of sweetness. Earthy brett tones bring it down. Hops arent as prevalent. Just a bit of tropical fruit up front and then they fade. Medium body. High carbonation. Drinks pretty easily, but I can already feel full as I finish this review. Very impressive.

Bottle from Julios. Pale yellow hazy with fluffy white head and lace. Lemon pastry with light funky tang musky aroma. Tropical fruit pineapple mild sweetness with some grassiness in citrus hop dry refreshing finish. Light and lively and soft. When I think of brett beer, this is what I am thinking of. Wicked fucking excellent.

Clear gold pour with a big white head that slowly fades to a cap. Aroma is musty barnyard funk, light citrus, grass, and slightly herbal. Taste follows. Some citrus zest in the aftertaste. Dry finish. Slight carbonation prickle.

Bottle courtesy of Håkan. Pours very hazy pale yellow with a big frothy offwhite head that leaves some sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and funky with crackers, pink grapefruit juice, pineapple, star fruit, moist grass, dry soil, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sour bitter, fruity and funky. Mouthfeel is dry, tiny tart, astringent, slightly sparkling and medium bodied. Finish is bitter with crackers, grapefruit juice, pineapple, star fruit, moist grass, dry soil, barnyard and lemon zest. Nice fruity funk. Perhaps a bit too bitter. Very solid!

Bottle. Thanks _angst_! Hazy golden liquid with huge off-white head. Aroma of mango, pineapple, grain, light barnyard, fresh hops and lychee. Taste is dry, light bitter and very light sour with notes of mango, pineapple, grain and light apple. Light to medium bodies with medium to high carbonation. Really good.

Bottle. It pours a nice pale golden color with a large, lasting frothy white head. The aroma has huge notes of pineapple, florals, toasty brett phenols with background notes of stone fruit. Really nice. The flavor is full with sweet stone fruits. Mostly mango and peach with background notes of passionfruit and pineapple. Light to medium levels of toasty, spicy brett funk underneath. The body is pretty full, and theres a good level of fruity sweetness to balance the brett funk and phenols. Wow. Im really digging this one. Basically this is a super fruity, dry, low bitterness IIPA with some brett funk in perfect balance to add some complexity without taking over the brew. Awesome stuff.

Poured from a bottle. 
Aroma is fairly tropical fruit forward with lots of pineapple and lighter mango and papaya. Moderate hop aroma with some citrus notes and a hint of pine. Some overripe melon notes with a bit of a peppery phenolic note. 
Pours a hazy, cloudy, yellow gold with a large, fairly thick and pillowy, white head that slowly recedes. Medium high lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly acidic with some medium, bready grain notes. Moderate bitterness with a white wine note. Some lighter pineapple, mango and melon. Medium light citrus notes with hints of pine. Light peppery phenolic notes. Light floral notes and some grass as well. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium high carbonation and a dry finish. Medium low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright beer with a nice aroma. Flavor has a slightly odd white wine note thats isnt great and kind of hides some of the other nice characteristics. Its also a bit too dry and astringent.

Prairie almost always doesnt live up to ratings. Aroma is very dusty brett with soft fruitiness. Taste is dusty cobwebby basement as the brett kind of takes over and drowns out the hops. Light tartness and no sweetness. Decent beer.
Getting better the more I drink it. Smells atrocious like urine and dirty socks. Tastes slightly yeasty but very smooth pours yellow with a white head best in style
Yellow pour from bottle at home. Has the baby diaper aroma. Taste is lemon and spicy. Fruity and tasty

Bottle @ Hoffbros. Hazy gold with an eggshell white head. Nose is strongly of brett. Approaches being eggy. Dried wood and manure. Taste is more palatable. Super dry forest floor. Some mango. Light body, soft carb.

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma is very Brett forward with almost an egg note with light grain, flora and light fruits underlying. Flavor has a sweet citrus and flora with a good amount of funk and light grain.

Bottle. Pours a pale yellow with a slight orange tint; white head that leaves some lacing behind. Smells very fruity, citrus, some funky yeast. Medium bitterness; moderate malt sweetness up front. Bitter, fruity Cascade finish.

Pours a hazy orange with white head. Light to medium body. Really bready and malty, very light fruity sweetness with a little bit of hop flavor. Some saltiness throughout. Not a huge fan unfortunately.
Bottle..Pour is golden with a fluffy white head..Nose is lemon, funk, hop, dank, sweat, musty...Taste is musty, spice, lemon , honey, pineapple, hop spice, fairly hoppy..very easy drinking..

My Bottom Line:
This tantalizing Wild Ales pineapple and coconut pith nuances ride a dry and bubbly mouthfeel to delightfully unique moments that seem to juxtapose salty minerals, tropical fruit juiciness and that je-ne-sais-quoi character stemming from brettanomyces clausenii. Oh my.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A fluffy head of foam dwindles into the misty blond.
-The finish is easygoing with barely any acidity or bitterness.
-Strangely enough, this isnt intensely funky.
-Everything is perfectly balanced.
-There is no sign of alcohol here.
-Salt is intelligently used in this one; it is not promiment, yet you know it is responsible for some of this brews idiosyncracies. 
-Hill Farmstead lovers take notice. This is a masterpiece which is going to be right up your alley.

Bottle.
16.9 oz bottle. Cloudy yellow with a decent white head. Aroma is of funk, hay, straw, lemon, more hay. Taste is of hay, grain, citrus, straw, funk and dry.
Bottle. The look is a light head, golden colored, and a white head. The smell is salt, tart, fruit, earthy, rustic. The taste is salt, light, farmhouse, earthy, and ok.
Pale gold pour, fairly large head. Brett, tropical fruit and salt in aroma and taste. Medium to light body. Funky but not overly so.
Smells clean american farmhouse. Sea salt taste. Yellow with generous head. Very approchable.

8oz pour at the Argosy. A little muted on the hops or they are getting drowned out by the bugs. Light hops and a bit tart both in the aroma and flavor. A little bitter on the finish. The hops are the tropical tasty variety but it is a struggle to find them and experience them in the flavor.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a tulip. Hazy yellow with big white head. Aroma is herbal hops, medium body, well carbonated, and no lacing. Taste is yeasty, pepper, some earthiness, some citrus, herbal hops, and slightly dry/slightly bitter finish.
Draught at HopScotch. Citrus hops, orange, pear, bit of funk and pepper, salt, lactose, light earthy finish. Somewhat almost too smooth, was expecting more funk and craziness for the price tag.
Smells like dirty lake water and oak. Pours golden with a white ring. Can be a little stinky at times. Heavily carbonated. Medium sour taste.

16.9 oz bottle purchased at Gomers Stateline in Kansas City, Missouri. The pour is a hazed yellow golden with a frothy one inch pure white head. The aroma is funk, leather, body odor, some tangerine and citrus peel. The taste has a nice Brett expression - funk, leather, hay, only minor bits of the body odor along with full fruit nectarine citrus and some grain to the finish. The dry finish reveals some sea salt. The palate is medium bodied, slick mouthfeel, soft carbonation, and Brett yeast, funk, citrus and sea salt in the aftertaste. Fun beer, quite a bit going on here.

Bottle share at GBBF, thanks!! Hazy yellow, still, small foamy white head. Aroma is hoppy - dank with straw, lemon, lime and kiwi. Fruity. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is kiwi, salty, green Starburst, tangy fruits with a sour finish. Pretty, pretty good.
Bottle: Poured a hazy straw yellow with a white head. Aroma is funky barn yard and citrus. Taste is citrus, sour, funky and dry.
Bottle from total wines jax, pours cloudy golden, small white head. Major lemon and orange notes. Slight sour with a light body, light carbonation.

Tap at Hopscotch. Nice aroma, citrus, Brett, bit grainy, but funk is at the top. Taste is nice, light funk, yoghurt, citrus, herbal, touch of salt if Im looking for it. Nice tartness. Very refreshing. Dont get the booze. Good stuff.

[ Bottle ][ 500mL ][ Texas Liquor ][ $15 ][ Reidel Vinum XL Pinot Noir ][ 8.18.15 ]
>> Hazy white straw pour, good foam. Nose is quite funky with beautiful zesty pomelo, inticing yuzu fruit. Taste is very dry, verging on paper. Hints of lightly sweetened green tea. Finish is dry and papery. Huh. Mildly bitter, but not hoppy... strange beer. Possibly heat damaged by distributor.

500 ml bottle. Enjoyed at San Diego, CA. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of fresh citrus, quite mellow yeastiness and brett. Flavour of crisp juicy bitterness, white grapes, orange peel, brett and quite complex yeastiness. Medium bodied. Really fresh and crispy. Great balance.
50 cl bottle @ hotel room, San Diego. Aroma has fruits, orange and bretta notes. Flavour has bretta notes, earth, orange and leather. Foamy and creamy palate. Pleasantly balanced and easy to drink.

50 cl bottle @ hotel room, San Diego.
Pours hasty yellow color with a large head. Lemony and soapy aroma, herbal tones and sour fruits. Sourish lemon and mandarin, funky earthy notes, spices and yeast. Well balanced.

500ml bottle

Pours hazy yellowish with a foamy white head. Aroma of salty and zesty lemon, bretta, leather, citrus, grass, hops and funky yeastiness. Taste is fruity, hoppy and citrusy with some zesty lemon, funky yeastiness and bretta notes. Finish is salty, tart and hoppy with some zesty lemon, citrus and bretta. Refreshing and tasty.
500 ml. bottle. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast, and malt. Taste is lemon, grapefruit, tropical, yeast, malt, and barnyard. Very good.

Bottle shared at GBBF 2015, day 1 - London. Big thanks to fly! Pours hazy yellow-gold with a creamy, white head. Lovely nose, ripe with lemon zest, brett, grapefruit and herbs. Light sweet flavor, a little bready, with notes of melon, light dough, citrus. Light bodied with average to lively carbonation and massaging texture. Sweet finish, lightly funky, with some airy lemon meringue and doughy white bread. Good stuff.

Tap at Hop-Scotch Prairie event. Light hazy yellow with a medium-sized eggshell colored soapy head. Aromas of brett, saison yeast, orange, mandarin with some lemon as well. Taste is more of the same. The funk is there, but is muted for a beer with Brett C. in the name. This is a good thing. The farmhouse character clearly stands out with the brett adding a bit more depth. Perfect spritzy saison-like mouthfeel. Hides the 8% ABV masterfully. Drinks like a well-made mimosa. Wonderful.

Wonderful aroma of citrus, lemon, grass clippings. Beautiful appearance with a nice pillowy head above orange golden body. Dry palate. Very good almost world class beer here.  A very good first beer from Prairie.

Hazy gold with a thin dissipating head that basically is no longer there after a minute. Very Bretty and horse-y aroma with some slightly Belgian tree-fruity and blonde malt tones on the nose. So much dry farmy Brett. The flavor is very smooth and rich, with bright hay and blonde malt tones mixing with a stern barnyard brettiness, and a equally stern pear and orange rind flavor with a very gentle finish of brineiness. Very eloquent and complex.

Bottle thanks to Fly. It pours cloudy gold with a small white head. The nose is earthy, musty, funky, bready malt, dirt, farmyard and white grapefruit. The taste is smooth,woody, grapefruit, lemon, sherbet,dirt, light herbal notes, minerals, dough and funky barnyard with a dry, juicy finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. A bit dirty, but I sort of like it.

2015-08-15. Hazy pale pastel yellow body with a small white head. 3+ Aroma is mild, fruity, light funk and lemon. Flavour is relatively mild, lemon and funk. Average plus bodied palate, good carbonation. Bottle at Campground Brewdown.

Bottle to glass. Pours a light golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma is very pleasant, fruity, floral, citrus. Flavor has a bit more yeasty funk to it, kind of dry in the finish. Love the aroma, but flavor was a bit lacking. Still not a bad beer.

Pours slightly cloudy pale orange gold, light white head. Aroma is manure, Brett, mad Dank funk, Puke, lemon, slight wet raccoon, day old citrus. Flavor is frankly georgeous, cites and grassy sweet fruity hop second. Nice fing stuff.

Kicking dont buy this round here sos I can get my greedy hands on some more hehe
Sour lemon chamomile on acid sea spray funk ass aroma

Bottle at GBBF 2015. I think it was brought by Fly, huge thanks. Hazy yellow/golden beer with a rich white head. Hoppy yeasty brett aroma, leather, grass, floral, herbal, spicy notes. Fruity yeasty brett flavor, grape fruit, grass, herbal, lemon notes, lemongrass, some peach and pine apples. Lovely!

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is tropical fruit, guava, slightly moldy peaches / strawberries, musty things, minerals, hooves, bones. Taste is fermented fruits of all kinds...peels, rinds, flesh, pits, all the parts...rotten in all the right ways. This is why I love Prairie.

From bottle to snifter. Amazingly complex aroma of citrus, tangerine, chaffed wheat, and moderate low barnyard. Absolutely perfect, beautiful aroma. Slightly tilled earth as it warmed. Hazy yellow with full white head. Taste exhibits a moderate high amount of barn, earth and fall meadow. The death of the flavor exhibits a juicy-fruit aspect. Mouthfeel is coating, but not overly so. Very slight alcohol warmth. There is a nice semi-dry aspect to the finish. This beer is incredible.
Bottle. Hazy straw yellow pour, with a fluffy white head. Nice bretty funk, hay, lemon, citrus, hoppy, grassy, earthy, lightly sweet, and finishes dry. Tasty.
Draft at Parlor City. Pours bright hazy golden with some white head. Nose is barnyard and lemon. Taste is same. Nice dry aftertaste. Good.
500 ml bottle from Cappys. Nice looking pour. Lemon funky nose. Taste is yeasty and lemony with brett. Some tropical fruit notes. Nice.

Had a snifter of this at Pogo Jacks Pub, on pirate night .. . pours a hazy amber tan .. lots of pirate lacing, good head, one eye .. . So much Brett that i feel i might turn into a dude named Brett and that would be terrifying.

between 4.2-4.3, but a favorite among 2 other 4.2 beers, so I gotta go high. Wonderful barnyard and big juicy hop nose. Flavor is subdued at first, by comparison, but opens up very nicely and finishes dry. Another great Prairie beer!

Tap at James McNelles in downtown Tulsa, OK
Pours hazy light orange dark yellow hue with a frothy white head and great lacing. Nose is bigtime hops, lite sea salt, brett funk-all great things. Flavors exhibit the hops up front with tons of bretty buggy yeast notes. I expected a bit more sourness/salt from the sea salt additions but i barely got any. Long bretty finish with a pinch of hop bitterness. Cool brew however it suffered a bit from a boring palate.

Bottle to snifter. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a medium white head, all tiny bubbles. Velvety. Nose is earthy, hay, straw, citrus punch hops. Taste is more citrus forward than Brett. A sharp biting carbonic bite. Very biting to the point of distracting from the flavor. Man, the high carbonation really kills this for me.

Bottle. Cloudy, bright gold with a thick, foamy, white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of lemon, bretty funk, straw, passion fruit, light pepper and grass. Flavor is the same. Medium bodied, crisp with a dry end.

Beautiful citrus aroma with a hint of sour and bitter. Crisp on the tongue, lightly sour, but smoother on the finish. Not something I could drink a lot of but a good beer nonetheless. Probably something for an acquired taste.

Bottle. Hazy yellow orange pour with a big white head. Citrus, wheat, lemon zest. Strong carbonation. Sweet sour and bitter body. Nice sour finish.

Bottle. Pours light gold with a head that has some staying power.Aroma of straw, pears, and citrus. Flavor is terrific, so well balanced, light tartness of a not quite ripe peach, light bitterness, a little funk that all play together very nicely. Finishes long and full with a jammy sweetness fading to an earthy hoppiness.Terrific.

With Audrie at Brass Tap, Coral Sorings, pour a beautiful lemon colored pour with a nice white head. Nose is tart and citrus . Taste is hoppy and tart with the citra hop easily appreciated. Finish is mild bitter citrus, very drinkable, the citra hop really brings out the beer. Quaff Score 7 / 10

11th August 2015GBBF Day 1. Bottle share thanks to Fry. Cloudy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry. Decent fine carbonation. Mildly savoury brett. Little dried fruits, tangy. Mild sweet floralness. Light savoury finish. All right.

Pours hazy lemon-yellow with a very thick eggshell head. My sample fizzed like mad, so have a big, thirsty towel handy if you buy a bottle. Aroma has malty, yeasty and fruity tones. Yeasty, malty flavor has a strong fruity underpinning of apple, tangerine and banana with wheaty hints and a bit of salt. Smooth, firm texture presents good fizz. Bottoms up!

Draught at the Tap and Mallet in Rochester NY. Poured a little cloudy golden colour, white head that was not held for long, fare amount of lace. Smells a bit funky and fruity. Tasted just awesome, tropical fruit, a little bitter, almost more of an IPA feel. Really delicious.
Bottle. Glowing pastel yellow, cloudy, high, ariy hed. Urinal cake, grapefruit. Grass, funk.. Soft, silky minerals and grapefruit, funk, catpiss, great silky body. Love it.

Bottle shared at gbbf 3015. Thanks to fry. Aroma is big classic big fruity Brett, wheat grains, pez sweets. Pineapple. Lemon. Peach. Translucent yellow / straw coloured pour with a lively white head. Flavour is composed of lemony, fruity hop, passion fruit and mango, hoppy gunky goodness. Palate is spritzy, light, fresh grains, really good.
Bottle at GBBF 2015... Hazy amber.. Big white head.. Zezty funk fruit nose.. Sharp tart fruits nose.. Juicy fruits.. Light dry bretty fruits.. Nice refreshing
50 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow, small white head. Aroma is citrusy and bretty. Apples, bretty, fruity. Mild citrusy. Medium dry bretty. Smooth fruity. Bitter and medium dry finish.

On tap at the 1 year anniversary of The Stags Head, Raleigh, NC. Light golden yellow pour with a short almost white head. Aroma of tropical fruits and faint citra hops. Taste is great with hints of sourness upfront, bitter piney hops, and tropical fruits. Almost unrecognizable as a saison (tastes like a dry-hopped sour or brett IPA). Regardless, the results are great.

650 mL bottle. Medium yellow with a huge foamy white head and some particulate. Funky yeast, dill pickles, resiny, lemon juice and wheat. Taste is a blend a mix of sweetness, light bitterness and sour. Body is medium with a fizzy feel.
A really good saison. Light, crisp, peppery, and funky. Apricots and light tropical fruits.

Bottle at home. Pours a cloudy yellow with a white, fizzy head. Decent head retention. Aroma is hoppy, tropical fruit, apricot, pineapple and citrus. Faint Brett funk. Taste is fantastic. Tropical fruit, apricots, grapefruit. Faint bitterness fades in and out. Brett, yeast, light pepper. Great hoppy saison. Light body, light mouthfeel, bubbly carbonation. Excellent.

On tap at Libertys. Hazy orange color. Thin white head. Leaves some good ridges of lace. Nice citrus, lemon. Belgian saison yeast. Mild pepperiness. Bit of pleasant farmhouse funk. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Mild dry finish. Moderate sweet taste, light bitter. Solid farmhouse brett ale, but not all that much going on. A belgian farmhouse with mild brett.

Sampled at Midwest Belgian Beer Fest 2015 - Pours hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma has funk, tropical hops, pine and grapefruit. It has a medium clear body with soft carbonation. The flavor starts with tropical fruits, malt and funk. The finish is fruit and shows some alcohol. Decent.
